1.text: As snow in summer, and as rain in harvest, so honor is not seemly for a fool.

2.text: As the bird by wandering, as the swallow by flying, so the curse causeless shall not come.

3.text: A whip for the horse, a bridle for the ass, and a rod for the foolâ€™s back.

4.text: Answer not a fool according to his folly, lest you also be like to him.

5.text: Answer a fool according to his folly, lest he be wise in his own conceit.

6.text: He that sends a message by the hand of a fool cuts off the feet, and drinks damage.

7.text: The legs of the lame are not equal: so is a parable in the mouth of fools.

8.text: As he that binds a stone in a sling, so is he that gives honor to a fool.

9.text: As a thorn goes up into the hand of a drunkard, so is a parable in the mouths of fools.

10.text: The great God that formed all things both rewards the fool, and rewards transgressors.

11.text: As a dog returns to his vomit, so a fool returns to his folly.

12.text: See you a man wise in his own conceit? there is more hope of a fool than of him.

13.text: The slothful man said, There is a lion in the way; a lion is in the streets.

14.text: As the door turns on his hinges, so does the slothful on his bed.

15.text: The slothful hides his hand in his bosom; it grieves him to bring it again to his mouth.

16.text: The sluggard is wiser in his own conceit than seven men that can render a reason.

17.text: He that passes by, and meddles with strife belonging not to him, is like one that takes a dog by the ears.

18.text: As a mad man who casts firebrands, arrows, and death,

19.text: So is the man that deceives his neighbor, and said, Am not I in sport?

20.text: Where no wood is, there the fire goes out: so where there is no talebearer, the strife ceases.

21.text: As coals are to burning coals, and wood to fire; so is a contentious man to kindle strife.

22.text: The words of a talebearer are as wounds, and they go down into the innermost parts of the belly.

23.text: Burning lips and a wicked heart are like a potsherd covered with silver dross.

24.text: He that hates dissembles with his lips, and lays up deceit within him;

25.text: When he speaks fair, believe him not: for there are seven abominations in his heart.

26.text: Whose hatred is covered by deceit, his wickedness shall be showed before the whole congregation.

27.text: Whoever digs a pit shall fall therein: and he that rolls a stone, it will return on him.

28.text: A lying tongue hates those that are afflicted by it; and a flattering mouth works ruin.
